alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 11:53AM PST until December 24 at 10:38AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .The river at Potlatch will continue to recede through today and will recede below flood stage tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River At Potlatch. * WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:30 AM PST Thursday the stage was 16.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:30 AM PST Thursday was 17.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 16.4 feet late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 16.8 feet on 11/23/1990. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 800 PM PST.
